website_summaries.verdict: The carbon steel material allows this model to be used a lot without wearing down, for users who need to cut a lot of wire without the need for shaping.
pros: The heavy-duty carbon steel is the primary benefit of this model
Strong, durable, and lightweight, these cutters can be used by anyone for household tasks but also hold their own at the job site
We are impressed by the cutting power — up to 16 gauge copper or soft wire
There are no wire shaping features, but for simple cutting and splicing, these are a good option
cons: On heavier gauges, this model will not give as clean a cut as higher end models

customer_reviews.title: Loose hinge pin and the jaws don't line up on 2 new pairs.
customer_reviews.text: These used to be great, but either the manufacturer's tooling or QA have gone downhill in the last several months. Maybe it's time to rebuild some of the machines? On the last ones I ordered, the hinged is slightly loose, and the jaws don't line up properly (which kind of defeats the purpose of a flush cutter if you ask me). Amazon sent a replacement, and it had the same problems. 2 of the pictures are my old ones purchased ~11mo ago and used (not abused) consistently since. I'd say which 2, but Amazon reorders them. Anyways, you can probably guess which are the new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Invalid Entry

customer_reviews.title: A high quality tool but priced in the low-quality range. A "Win-Win" for buyers.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these for the singular purpose of providing clean wire cuts on these connectors: I've since learned that they are a lot more versatile, and very valuable. Yes, they allow me to cleanly and precisely cut my CAT5/6 wire pairs at exactly 90-degrees, but also allow me flush-cut plastic posts on project cases (I'm an electronic nut who builds his own projects and then jams them into existing or newly purchased enclosures). They're good, they work well, and I would recommend them. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Critical

customer_reviews.title: The. Best.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been askeered of these snip-type cutters - they always sent a tail flying...the same shock force that did that went into the component! diodes don't like that treatment. Scissor (shear) style cutters don't shock components while cutting the leads. Well. Shear style scissor cutters can't do a flush cut. And I cant explain how these things cut so smoothly without ANY shock, without sending the clipped tail flying. As a matter of fact; it's a bit irritating that the cut-off tail STAYS in the cutter jaws! What manner of sorcery goes on here?
customer_reviews.author: Big dumb goof

customer_reviews.title: Soft metal, waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: After about an hour of average use clipping excess from resistors, capacitors, etc., the tip of the cutters is so bent that it will not trim anything really close to the circuit board. I'm not a factory and this was really mild use for a set of cutters. Very disappointed in the crap quality of the metal they are made out of. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Precision cutters
customer_reviews.text: This is a delicate tool and is meant for cutting SOFT material. I ruined my first pair trying to cut steel nails with it. (Don't try that!) I did purchase a second pair, which I will take better care of. These work great for precision cutting, for example to flush cut material. I used it recently to cut some zip ties so that the tail would be flush with the head, so as to not have any jagged edges. Prior to that I had tried with a pair of scissors and could not get the cut flush, and the zip tie's tail end was a little too sharp for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Chue X

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool!
customer_reviews.text: I am both a handy man for a living as well as a hobbyist and I don't know how I would make it without a nice pair of micro cutters. I mean I LOVE this little tool. I got my first pair when I was about 14 or 15 years old and I have been using micro cutters ever since. In my personal opinion, they are simply one of the most useful tools I've ever had. I think this brand in particular is reliable and durable. I have been using mine regularly for around a year or more now and they are still going strong. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of junk in Hakko packaging!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these cutters before and was very happy with them so I decided to buy another pair. The outside of the box said Hakko but inside the box was a pair of cutters with a blue handle. They NOT Hakko and were junk! I immediately returned them for a refund. So remember the genuine Hakko cutters look like the ones in the description with a red & black handle.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Cutting 3-D Printing Sprues!
customer_reviews.text: I build miniatures and I often use 3-D printed kits. The sprues holding these tiny objects in place are difficult to cut using an X-acto knife-type cutting blade. These cutters are perfect for this as they skim under the objects very close to the junction of the sprue to the object and cut it apart from its base. This close cut minimizes sanding and pieces flying off the items--and I haven't lost a single mini since using them! I recommend them for all people who need sharp, accurate and close cutting nippers! These are great and a super value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: craftsare4me

customer_reviews.title: Specialty Cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are not a substitute for a full size set of side cutters. These are ideal for working with small wires where precision cuts are necessary. I used them for years while installing car alarms and car audio products. They make it easy to isolate and snip a single wire in a bundle without risking the others. With a little practice, you can also turn them around and they make great wire insulation strippers. You just have to be careful to only cut the insulation and not into the wire. Highly recommended for use as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jakubczak

customer_reviews.title: Strong out of the gate but....
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited initially.... The first few days were great.... And then they started getting dull AND the hinge must have loosened but the Jaws no longer met evenly and they wouldn't even work at all. It was favorable of me to not go 1 star.... On the first pair And then the replacement pair came and the Jaws were not aligned from the start as you can see from picture .... They are crap I'm afraid. Time to go find something new I guess.... Unless someone has a compelling reason to go for pair #3
customer_reviews.author: You don't need my name

customer_reviews.title: Septum ring removal! Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Alrighty. I’m preface this with - ‘Don’t try this at home’. Nevertheless, it worked!!! My horseshoe septum piercing was stuck. I couldn’t get either ball loosened at home. Two piercers at the local tattoo shop were also unsuccessful in removing it. We discussed options and he reluctantly mentioned wire cutters. I knew amazon would have a rock bottom price for a good pair. THESE WORKED LIKE A CHARM. Scared the pants off me when it cut through the 14g horseshoe hut that was doe to my fragile nerves and images OFM me cutting my nose off. All is well and I’m on to a new septum ring that looks great!! I highly recommend these cutters!!
customer_reviews.author: Moto Psycho

customer_reviews.title: Awesome small pliers/clippers!
customer_reviews.text: These are great - I've gotten two now, one for my workshop and one for my backpack. They do exactly what they say on the box; they're small wire clippers, they have comfortable grips, good leverage, and the steel on the clippers seems to be pretty high quality. The first one I got is starting to get some minor chips and dings, but I use these for things well beyond their intended use of clipping wires. Leverage to pry on small casings, tearing open obnoxious packaging, gripping weird screw heads, etc. I also like the admonition printed on the handle, "USE SAFETY GLASSES." Geez, pliers, I'm just tearing a plastic bag open! But okay, okay, safety first...
customer_reviews.author: wrr

customer_reviews.title: Nice, inexpensive, comfortable, work well
customer_reviews.text: These are spring loaded, very comfortable to hold, work well. I only use them for cutting 3D printing filament (PLA, ABS, etc.), I broke another product (different manufacturer) trying to cut the wall of a thick print (about 2mm PLA, plastic is surprisingly strong :-)), I would not recommend using these for thick material. I may use them for thin wire, but that is not intended as I am trying to keep the edges sharp (I have other tools specifically used on wire).
customer_reviews.author: sanslos

customer_reviews.title: Used as cat nail clippers - has changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: I have some cranky older cats with very thick nails that curl right under themselves to the point where I cannot use typical cat nail clippers. I bought these and gave them a try. Not only do they solve the problem of cutting a curled-under nail (you can start by just nipping at it from the outside of the curve if necessary), but these are stronger and offer many more useful angles. I have one cat who used to be so angry about nail-clipping time that she nearly always had a heart attack, hissing and spitting and biting me. Not so anymore. These are so much stronger that they get right through those ultra-thick old-cat nails. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Norah Snorrah

customer_reviews.title: Now with soap
customer_reviews.text: Item was pristine inside bag, but bag was covered with soap. Shipper placed the soap covered plastic bag in another plastic bag and shipped it anyways. No other items in the shipment had soap on them. It appears to be from the distributor just not caring. Cutters are excellent though.
customer_reviews.author: Dumpling

customer_reviews.title: One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Got this, seeing s.o. I watch on YouTube use it in computer builds & repairs. Don't know how I lived without it! Mechanism works perfectly. Instead of an awkward use of use scissors, I can now cut zip ties in my computer w/o the fear of accidentally cutting or damaging an important cable. Surely other, equally good uses will present themselves in the future. I removed one star due to the issue that there's no way to "latch" this tool closed. It's always in the open position - blades & sharp points exposed. Makes storing the cutter properly a bit difficult. That aside, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: these REALLY work.
customer_reviews.text: these REALLY work. bought a few other pairs that wouldn't even cut a shoelace, I almost gave up. bought for acoustic guitar strings and they're perfect. easily cuts the wire and they're very thin so you can cut strings close against the nut. get em!
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Jai

customer_reviews.title: My favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over 3 years ago, built several raspberry pi projects and abused it during a year long electrical project cutting anything from 20 awg wire, metal coat hangers to 2 awg wire. 10/4 Romex finally broke them.. After 3 years of heavy use. These have been my favorite since I bought them and lasting my abuse for 3 years, it's time to buy another one. With normal use, this will probably be your last pair you'll have to buy.
customer_reviews.author: HomeTheaterLover

customer_reviews.title: This is an extremely nice pair of Made in Italy wire cutters for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely nice pair of Made in Italy wire cutters for the price. The shears themselves have a nice flat grind so they can be held flush against what you need to cut (great for precision wire cuts or cleaning up leads after soldering), they cut nicely (through soft metal), and the spring mechanism is much more reliable than some of the other leaf-spring designs you see at this price point. The handles don't have that Chinese-regrind smell or stickiness and are very comfortable to hold. Keep in mind that these are meant for wires and other similar <1.3mm soft metal, and aren't meant for heavier duty wires.
customer_reviews.author: C. YangTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning up 3d prints!
customer_reviews.text: My included cutter that came with my 3d printer quickly had the handle covers rip near the base. This made them uncomfortable, but i kept using them. After trying to take the handle off to repair and subsequently ruining the mechanism i wemt off searching for a longer term solution to my 3d print finishing needs. All thiugh the price is higher than the free product i recived with the printer, the ~$10 price for these is well worth it. Comfortable handles rhat have yet to show any signs of failure. Work well for cleaning up my 3d prints!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great, and amazingly they tell you their maximum cutting capacity on the handle!
customer_reviews.text: these work just fine, as advertised and expected. But, "Wait!" as they say on late-night TV, "there's more!." They are the only pair of cutters I think I have that actually say what is the maximum gauge you can cut, right on the handle.I would venture that someone who buys a tool like this has a LOT of cutters and unless they are Deep Blue or Einstein don't remember exactly what the limits are for each one.So, this is very handy, thanks. Are any other tool makers listening???
customer_reviews.author: Hgnomentat

customer_reviews.title: Have kids or buy anything with 84 zip ties?
customer_reviews.text: These cut stranded copper wire nicely without stragglers, but what we use them for much more often is zip tie cutting. Kids toys seem to come with 115 zip ties holding them into their taped cardboard vaults. These are perfect for cutting these tight ties, even if you can't fit the tip under them. Just bought a set of clamps at Home Depot this morning, they had 6 zip ties holding them together; this was the perfect tool to avoid frustration, knives, cursing, etc. Inexpensive, ergonomic, made in Italy, and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Benjo

customer_reviews.title: Not flush.
customer_reviews.text: A key part of a "flush cutter" is the bottom surface being flush. This item was not and had enough of a difference to impact it's usage. I was unable to get flush, flat cuts off of simple PLA (used it for removing a 3d print's supports). I am sure it will cut wire, but if you want a smooth surface after cutting bits and pieces off, look elsewhere. It is a shame, because the brand could be excellent and I just happened upon another counterfeit product sold via scammers.. I will never know, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Broke after limited use (5 mo old)
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 03/23/2019. Using them last week 08/19/2019 one of the cutting edges completely snapped off cutting 18 AWG stranded wire. The grain structure in the metal shows that it was not hardened properly. Unfortunately their warranty is only 90 days. I am now 150 days. I would not recommend this product as there are other suppliers who offer the same product with a better warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice little flush-cutters
customer_reviews.text: They're not labeled Hakko, but the are identical to the ones listed on Hakko's website, so they're likely legit (a little surprising seeing anything from Hakko so affordable). My guess is they're contract units. Either way, they're fine quality. They have smooth, positive action and leave a clean cut (not as clean an more expensive cutters, but those are more expensive). They're intended for electronics use, so as long as you stick to copper and component leads, they should provide you reliable service for a long time. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Reed

customer_reviews.title: Amazing snippers
customer_reviews.text: I tried several different tools I had, and bought a few different type cutters, including this, to find something that would do a clean cut of paracord for sleeving computer cables. These were by far the best tool for the job and work almost perfectly. I've also used them for cutting plastic sleeving, heatshrink, wire, velcro, and probably a couple other things I'm forgetting. The only issue I have with them is I wish the cutting edge was about 1/16-1/8" longer. So many times, especially with the heatshrink, it would cut 99% of the way through but would leave a tiny bit hanging on, because the length of the blades is just a hair too short.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Work great...
customer_reviews.text: They work great, just dont accidentally grab the wrong flush-cut snippers and try and cut a 24ga steel wire. These did not forgive that blunder and now I have several small indents in the cutting blades from where the 24g (it was braided) unraveled and destroyed little spots on them. They still do their job, just the outer 1/2 of the cutting area is effectively out-of-service. 1 Star off because I thought that them being made of hardened steel would have given me some wiggle room from being stupid when doing wire work.
customer_reviews.author: D.McReynolds

customer_reviews.title: Blades overlaps
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, the blades slides and overlaps and need to repeat the procedure several times just to cut a thin 20 lbs braided line. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Best flush cutters I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These are the best flush cutters! I had my last pair for about 8 years and put a ton of ‘miles’ on them as an AV systems installer, service tech and all the AV jobs I have had the last 8 years. They never got dull and if it wasn’t that the spring got very weak after 8 years and it bothers me since I use them so much I wouldn’t have needed to replace them. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard P

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. With the hakko name I expect top quality
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. With the hakko name I expect top quality. Blades are not parallel and will not cut any wire cleanly or efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: mike stevens

customer_reviews.title: Typical Excellent Hakko Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are not my first Hakko cutters. I've bought them for short run PCB assembly work, use at the electronics bench, field wiring, etc. I bought these cutters to make nice square cuts to clean up the end of the ABS filament that I use in a 3D printer. ABS is certainly no match for these excellent Hakko cutters, but overkill is good. Good tools make any job easier and produce better results. Good tools also make me feel good when I'm using them. I always wonder how Hakko can make these very nice cutters for such a low price. They seem like they should cost two or three times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Layne

customer_reviews.title: For "soft copper" only!
customer_reviews.text: Copper comes in different hardness for different things. These worked just fine for a couple of weeks until I grabbed a piece of "medium-hard copper" wire. It was only a puny 20ga wire so I didn't think anything of it. My the time I realized that every cut left a dent in the cutting edge, it was too late, they are off to the garbage. I gave them 2 stars because they are cheap enough I may buy another pair. If I re-buy, they will be set aside and only used on the softest of copper wire. That's what I usually use anyway. You do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Premeditated Trouble

customer_reviews.title: GOOD FOR TIGHT SPACES.
customer_reviews.text: I rewired my '72 Chevy LUV after installing a 350 Chevy motor. There were a lot of wires to sensors and such that were no longer needed, so I had to rip apart the wiring harness to remove the unneeded wires. The fine cutting tip on this cutter made it easy to slip underneath the harness to cut it open, especially in tight spots, like under the dash. The cutters are sharp and worked perfect for what I wanted this for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small zip ties, but not quite ideal for anything a little beefier
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever tried cutting a wire with a thick pair of scissors? And as you put pressure the scissors kind of bend out of shape and really struggle to cut it? That's a little bit how it is working with these snips. These things are AWESOME for small zip ties, and would be great to throw in a portable kit of some kind, but if you're thinking of cutting anything other than the smallest wires (Doesn't work well on stranded core wires) then you're going to want something a little beefier
customer_reviews.author: Christian L

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality metal does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality metal does not hold up. Literally, the metal chips away after using for just 3 months. Cheaper than others, but you get what you pay for. A waste of money if you want to use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: The BEST cutter/snip/mini dykes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best mini snip/cutter/dykes I've ever owned. Period. These cut stranded wire (16ga and less) perfectly, leaving nothing but a trimmed edge. They don't "smash " through the wire like other tools will. What I like best: 1. Cuts the unneeded end of nylon/plastic tie straps flush 2. Removes nylon/plastic tie straps without nicking wire insulation. 3. Let's you cut a wire harness sheath off without touching any wire inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Schutt

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY TO MAKE CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: It’s SO SIMPLE TO MAKE DECISION !!! - If a tool has 5,000 reviews with 4,7 avg rating - Other similar and quality costs 5-10 time more - This one is only $5 ???? I’m diesel mechanic so use it mostly for cutting zip-ties and wiring. This cutter has access everywhere because of tiny and angled sharp blades. Always carry in my t-shirt pocket This is my second pair. First one lost but didn’t cry for $5
customer_reviews.author: Bud Stan

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for cutting beading wire.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to cut beading wire for making jewelry. (using it to cut 0.61 mm (.024") wire) Works better than anything else that I tried to use. Cuts clean through with little effort. Didn't need to use any force and worked great just using the tip of the cutter. I will be buying more for back up.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality Wire Cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are very high quality wire cutters that I keep in my desk drawer as they are far more useful than only cutting wires. The blades are sharp, and the handles have a nice rubber coating so your hands aren't strained. The mechanism keeps the blades open, and unlike some other wire cutters I have purchased, I'm not worried about them breaking and then defaulting to a closed position. I mostly use them in place of scissors to cut small plastic tags off of clothing, as I am less worried about damaging the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I use them to cut dies and these do a great job at getting close to the die so you don't have any extra stuff hanging causing you to get stabbed in the hand or end up making an impression on your paper.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Roell

customer_reviews.title: Cast is brittle and fails easily. Disappointed as I really liked them
customer_reviews.text: I thought they were OK for several months, then one side of the blade snapped off. It is cast metal. You can tell by looking at it. Cast is brittle and fails easily. Disappointed as I really liked them. Ordered these instead. They are the real deal. NOT cast. Tough as nails. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Feels well made! My go-to tool for small electronics repairs.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is the absolute best cutter I've ever used. I commonly work on small electronics, and have always used just the cutters from the typical mini pliers sets that you get at Home Depot and Lowes. This thing blows them out of the water for quality and how well it does the job. I can cleanly cut even the tiniest of electronic components mounted to the board for quick and easy removal. I can't believe they sell these this cheaply! I'd pay double for this tool. The build quality feels great, and it feels like you paid a lot for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Good for softer 22 gauge wires and Smaller
customer_reviews.text: I love these and they have lasted me a long time (over a year), BUT I am very picky as to what I cut with them. If you cut wire that is too hard or too thick you will put little indentions in the blades easily. I cut only Nichrome 80 and A1 Kanthal in 22 gague or smaller (large number). I had a friend try to cut A1 Kanthal 16/18 gague (can't remember which) and it shattered one of the sides of the clippers and it broke off. He had a pair identical to mine. Took a long time to ship but considering where it was coming from that should have been expected.
customer_reviews.author: GretchyTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Used for the Christmas light season
customer_reviews.text: I started working with my friend putting up and taking down Christmas lights in 2019. These cutters are excellent. We put up 175 homes of Christmas lights and these were a lifesaver. It was very easy to make inline males and females. Worked great while cutting bailing wire the thick kind too. I ended up loosing them somewhere and ill have to buy it again for the 2020 season.
customer_reviews.author: USA OutdoorsmanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: As good as branded big-box store cutters
customer_reviews.text: I have used the heck out of these for several months and they perform just as well as the first time. They cut flush and are quite sharp. I bought them as a backup set to my primary cutters in my solder kit and they have become my primary ones now. No issues with fit/finish or symmetry and they’re very comfortable to use, even for hours on end. I recommend these for any soldering kit or station or anywhere you plan to do a lot of light-gauge wire cutting.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly clean cut!
customer_reviews.text: For the money these snips exceeded all of my expectations. We previously we using professional grade snips and honestly we thought they were great. We wanted to get a spare set each so we found these and bought two. After using them I was blown away at what we paid for the professional grade snips because these make a far better, much cleaner cut. If your still undecided about buying, rest assured these will certainly do the job. We use them for cutting sterling, 14k, and gold filled wire mostly (we're jeweler's) but I believe these will accommodate your needs for just about anything.
customer_reviews.author: ♥Mike-n-Kady♥

customer_reviews.title: Good clean cuts for the hobbyist or occasional user.  Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Nice! I've paid a lot more for the exact same quality! The clean, flush cutting design makes this a good choice for working on small electronic devices. If you're a pro clipping away day in and day out, you should consider a much higher quality tool. But if you're a hobbyist or occasional user, this should give you 500+ good cuts on wire around 20 gauge or smaller with no trouble. Good choice for clipping things like 1/4 watt resistor leads on circuit boards.
customer_reviews.author: photoroto

customer_reviews.title: They are not as sharp as I would like. I used these on Fascinations Iconx/Metal-Earth kits
customer_reviews.text: They are okay. They are not as sharp as I would like. I used these on Fascinations Iconx/Metal-Earth kits. They are better than other pairs I got from arts and craft stores, but they still weren't sharp or small enough. I ended up trying Knipex (sharper, but not smaller) and Xuron (sharper and smaller). The Xuron ones are the best. These are good for wires and such. They just didn't fill the task I needed them to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality ! Wish I had purchased sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I make jewelry. I’ve wasted money on cheap tools. It’s not worth it. Buy quality tools from the start - like this one. You’ll save yourself a lot of frustration, and it will be reflected in your work.
customer_reviews.author: 6-StringAcoustic

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably Smooth
customer_reviews.text: These things are super sharp and super smooth. I used them today when building a new Power Supply for my 3D Printer to snip wires from the original ATX connectors and trim off excess wire after re-soldering them to the PCB. The entire time I used them I couldn't believe how smooth every single cut was. The cuts were clean, and the effort needed to perform the cut was almost non-existent. I'm actually glad I lost my old Radio Shack cutters, I never imagined a cutter could be this good.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Grenier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Zip Ties.
customer_reviews.text: I'm an A&P and use a lot of zip ties and I bought these to clip the ends off flush. They are very well made and the cutting edge meats perfectly and the back is perfectly flush. I am very pleased. I would not recommend these if you are wanting wire cutters. They are simply not heavy enough for any wire above a .032 and even then I would not use them for that. They should be fine for multi-strand electrical wire up to around a 14 gauge. They are perfect for zip ties but being only 5" long they are just not heavy enough for most wires.
customer_reviews.author: Johnwp

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain on a fine set of cutters!
customer_reviews.text: These cut component leads flush with ease and the price is amazing for what appears to be a high quality tool. To be fair, they do have their limits. They are rated to cut copper only and only up to 1.3mm^2 (16AWG), but for the purposes of trimming component leads on PCBs, they are more than adequate and I have enjoyed using them in the lab. They work well on zip ties as well. 5/5, will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kwiecinski

customer_reviews.title: I used this for jewelry
customer_reviews.text: I hated a dangling part of one of my earrings (gold), and used this small cutter to cut it off. It did an amazing job and my earrings are pretty enough to wear now! I have also used it on a necklace made of non-precious material to cut off a part of it, and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Mango

customer_reviews.title: They are small and they cut. Flush. Thank ...
customer_reviews.text: They are small and they cut. Flush. Thank god! This wayyour zip ties don't turn into razor blades and leave you bleeding all over the place and in need of a trauma center.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: APR2019: The original pliers(s) are still in great shape & make clean cuts without any damage to the plier. Still my favorite & the one I reach for most, but at this price point I ordered another just in case (& so I have extra for when friends visit). ORIGINAL: I've ordered several pair of these (2 extras for me & several for classmates). Excellent price point. Made in Italy like another pair I have had for years. Blades are sharp with no gaps. These are intended for use with lighter gauge wire so I'll reserve my older pair for the heavier gauges (>16gauge, which is what they're for).
customer_reviews.author: beadygirl

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my old one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so that I would be able to cut the wire used to replace the hooks and pinecones to put on my tree. Basically, it was rough going. I reverted to my old sack that worked perfectly and could also call through stems on plastic flowers. My suggestion is that you purchase this item in a store that specializes in arts and crafts.
customer_reviews.author: ipka54

customer_reviews.title: My favorite new clippers
customer_reviews.text: Omg what have I been missing out on! Who knew I would be so excited for clippers.... these things are just so accurate and sharp it's made a smile on my face every time I use it. Not only have I used it for circuit board work, I even use it on other random things like cutting off skin from my fingernail area. Anyway, this is getting a little weird, so yeah I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty sturdy and well-made and I've had others where the tips will chip off after a while. It is easy to hold with a non-slip grip and I just keep them stored away with the rubber band around the handles to keep them in the closed position. Maybe a suggestion to the seller or manufacturer to add that in as a nice little feature. These work perfectly for those Precision Snips that you need to make.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F. FAIR, HONEST REVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Much better than diagonal cutters
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using typical side- or diagonal-cutters for my electronics work. I read a suggestion that I'd like these better. I didn't believe it would make much difference, really, but for this low price I figured I'd give these micro cutters a try. And to my surprise, they are much nicer. These are always front and center when I'm working on electronics now.
customer_reviews.author: EricS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little cutter
customer_reviews.text: I love this for wire cutting. Will cut up to 8ga wire (with a bit of work) Easy to cut if the wire will fit within the little opening. As for durability, i don't know as i lose these before i wear them out. i have cut about 40 (12ga) wires, and cutter still works great. Only downside? not good for stripping, as it cuts too fast.
customer_reviews.author: A nerd

customer_reviews.title: And they honestly are THE best tool to have for model building - basically
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my model building (cutting the plastic sprue). And they honestly are THE best tool to have for model building - basically, they are mini side cutters, that feel good in the hand, are surprisingly high quality, and are $5. You can get a crappy Chinese made version of these for the same price - yet these are a big step above. I also bought Hakko's needle nose plier version of these which are a must have when fitting tiny plastic pieces onto your models.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wurzel

customer_reviews.title: A 3D printing must!
customer_reviews.text: If you 3D print and you don't have this tool, reach in your back pocket, get your wallet out and buy this tool! It's great for snipping filament prior to feeding it into the extruder, removing support material, trimming models and those types of things. Great bang for the buck! Why wait?
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I love these cutters. They have a great feel and work just wonderfully. They are everything the seller said they would be.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Jaws don't stop at parallel - they slide past each other
customer_reviews.text: I got these, hoping for accurate, clean cuts for my reprap and aruino work. They started off fine, but after just moderate use they have overbite, which drives me nuts. If I cut, say some plastic wire wrap, when I release it I can feel and hear the cutting edges sliding back past each other into the nuetral position. Inspecting with a magnifying glass, sure enough, after the cut, I can see that the cutting edges have moved past closed, sliding down over each other (or, at least one is sliding past the other). I'm going to look for a replacement pair that's tighter.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: Good sharp cutters
customer_reviews.text: I bought some cutters from Harbor Freight because they were inexpensive; and you get what you pay for, they lasted about a week before they went dull and I still used them until they broke. These cuters are many steps ahead of the cheap HF cutters. These are sharp and after several weeks of using to tear apart 18650 battery packs, they're just as sharp as the day they arrived. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting sprues AND cutting Kanthal wire
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and effective sprue cutter for my Warhammer 40K models. These are, of course, no God Hand sprue cutters, but these are much more resilient. After hundreds of cuts, these are still relatively sharp and have not been. For all you RBA vapers out there, I've had no issues cutting 20 gauge kanthal wire with these either. Where as other sprue cutters would get dent cutting kanthal wire that thick, the blades on these cutters are still crisp. I will be buying more of these in the future, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Edward V

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until they didn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these sometime last year for use with my DIY projects. hey seemed to get dull pretty quickly. I noticed marks where I had cut a few wires that were not heavy at all. The other day, I heard a pop, and one of the blades simply went across the room. I have various tools for the right jobs. I don't believe I was pushing any limitation. In all honesty I'd buy them again, but I've been looking for warranty info to see what the manufacturer would say or do 1st but I can't find a thing. This will prevent me from buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Rudko

customer_reviews.title: Loose rivet...
customer_reviews.text: After just a few light duty soldering tasks and cutting small heat shrink, the tips are scissoring. Waste of money. Hakko is not a good name in soldering irons or tools, despite the marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Brackeen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shop cutters - great for wire ties!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for general shop use, but found that they are excellent for cutting off the ends of wire ties. Most cutters don't cut cleanly against the stop, but these slice cleanly right next to the stop and don't leave that sharp edge that will get you the next time you're working on the electrical components.
customer_reviews.author: Thom17043

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed it 😄
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to cut of the wires from electric guitars 🎸. They worked perfectly. They cut it with such ease. Highly Recommend this product. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Browneyez Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Put this in your cart right now.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know what I was missing out on. This cuts through stainless steel chain and wire so effortlessly! A steal! Ugh. I wish I could cut chain all day with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price in the case definitely means cheap quality. ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap price in the case definitely means cheap quality. Used to cut 26 gauge stainless wire and they're already dulled and no longer cut.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Work Alright For Modeling, Not For Fine Work
customer_reviews.text: I use these cutters to release parts from plastic trees for scale modeling, which is what my review is based on. For this purpose they work fairly well, but aren't the greatest. The jaws have a slight misalignment which can be an issue and the tips are quite thick to be called 'micro'. I now only use them for larger pieces as they have damage small and delicate parts before.
customer_reviews.author: Robin H

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my old pair
customer_reviews.text: When my husband left, he took all of my tools. This is a replacement for the old ones. I was glad to find a pair that works well, great on electronics and electrical work.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: These small cutters have been surprisingly durable. I use them daily while working on electronics. I’ve had them about 2 months and they are still working as good as they say I received them. These cutters are good for getting into tight spots on circuit boards especially. They are exactly what I needed and are better than the price I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: warramq

customer_reviews.title: Good for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: These cutters are amazing especially for the price. The first ones i bought lasted about 7 months before they were duller than i wanted them to be, but still work fine for cutting zip ties and bigger things. I am really hard on them and cut things they arent really meant to cut so i'm not even upset that they dulled. I still use them but ordered new ones so i would have a sharper pair. I honestly like these ones better than the expensive brands all the guys in the shop use. They are easier to hold and fit into really tight spaces. Perfect for electrical and wiring work.
customer_reviews.author: Anna D

customer_reviews.title: these work great for hobby use
customer_reviews.text: I have a Hakko 888 soldering station that I love and I decided to see if other Hakko-branded products meet the same standard. I find that these cutters do meet the standard. I was a little suspicious because the cutters are so inexpensive but I have been using them for awhile now and they work considerably better than 2 other pairs of flush cutters I own that were more expensive. They cut clean and close. The only thing I cannot swear to is longevity (don't know yet) but for this price and level of performance I would be happy to buy a new pair every year.
customer_reviews.author: JG (Highflyer)Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Stand up well to my abuse
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best little cutters around. I abuse mine and buy a new pair about once a year since I use them on all kinds of jewelry wire and not just tigertail of small guages. If I took better care they would last a lot longer, although I have to say even the old ones that don't work as well on the smaller finer wires still work fine for the heavier stuff. I chop off loops on charms made of zinc, chop off pcs of steel chain and even use them on guages up to 12. Yeah! I abuse them terribly. For the price they are excellent and last really well.
customer_reviews.author: Folks at the Hill Hobbit House

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for coils for RDA!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these specifically for cutting the ends of my coils for my RDA once the were set in place. I've tried many different cutters, but had very little success and only ended up frustrated with some messed up cuts. These work perfectly they cut nice and clean right up against the deck just as I hoped! I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cutters. Wish I had a pair 30 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I have been doing automotive and computer wiring repair and customization for over 30 years. These are great for automotive wiring repair, harness making, and computer cable sleeving. They cut so nice and clean and for the price, you can’t beat them. They cut better than snap on side cutters any day.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo M

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I've used on nothing but soldered audio cable and the tip snapped off. POS, junk.
customer_reviews.author: cbj gfk

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap, spend 3$ more to get a much better value.
customer_reviews.text: I use an Xcelite 170M at work, and thought it would be interesting to have one these on hand, when ever I need to break out the wires, and do an odd job here or there, or break out some sort of personal project. Unfortunately this wire cutter is no where near as good in the feel department or in it's function. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND spending 3$ more and getting an Xcelite 170M or equivalent, or even better, press the miss button on this one, the quality just isn't there, feels cheap, and it's not a great cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I really do love these cutters! I make handmade jewelry and needed wire cutters that weren’t super expensive or too big. For the delicate jewelry pieces this is great and doesn’t get in the way! Very durable and is still sharp to cut wire to this day! Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla c.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 2, one for the tool box and one for the electronic bench
customer_reviews.text: Nice, handy side cutters. I wouldn't and neither should you expect to cut any gauge greater than 12 with these cutters. Even 12 awg is a bit much if you expect to cut with one squeeze, but if you are like I, you can make do with these to cut 12 awg if you rotate around the copper wire. About 3 cuts should be fine. I don't plan on doing this too often, but I was testing them to determine what thickness I could get away with and not break them.
customer_reviews.author: senior_geek_cs_grad

customer_reviews.title: Better than higher priced cutters
customer_reviews.text: I love these cutters and the price is low. My xuron cutters handles slide off and were purchased to cut HO and N model train track. I was assured by reviewers that it was the only way to cut track. They did a poor job and the jaws are nicked up. I would only use flush cutters for soft copper or for clipping similar soft materials. My main complaint was the handles constantly sliding off. My Haako cutters hadles have stayed on and the blades are still good.
customer_reviews.author: Marke Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Work really well right out of the bag
customer_reviews.text: It is not advertized as jewelry making wire cutter but that's what I bought it for. My old cutter is getting a bit labored. I didn't know how bad my old cutter was until I tried this one out. I didn't even notice that the head pin was trimmed. The cut piece did not fly off the table. It's like putting a hot knife to butter. Longevity is unknown. I think these things all get misaligned and dull over time. Not misusing it and file the cutting edge at times would probably keep these cutters last longer than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Anony MouseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Work great for thru-hole PCB components.
customer_reviews.text: These cutters do exactly what they are supposed to do, cut thru-hole components flat after they are soldered in place. They feel good in your hand and the spring mechanism works very well. They are also very good as general wire cutters. I wouldn't recommend them for cutting heavy wire all the time, but for the occasional 14 or 16 AWG stranded they work very well.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Making Custom Length CAT6/7 Ethernet Cables
customer_reviews.text: Do you make you own CAT6/7 Ethernet cables? This little tool is a must own and will be needed for flush trimming the excess wire from a pass-through or load bar style connector. Seriously, you need this tool to be able to make your own CAT6/7 Ethernet cables and seeing how it only cost around $5 you really can't beat the price either 😀
customer_reviews.author: Weaver Cattle Company

customer_reviews.title: Very nice snips.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little snips for small electric work. Made in Italy. Build quality is very nice. Great value! If you're buying these, you probably already know it... heed the safety glasses warning or look away when you're snipping short lengths off small copper wire. These snips can send those tiny cut ends flying!
customer_reviews.author: dfbarnes

customer_reviews.title: blade chowdered on first cut
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed a small cutting head, but it says it can handle up to 1mm copper wire, now I didn't cut copper so therein perhaps is the very questionable performance claim, I used it to cut out some very small capacitors from a circuit, maybe .5mm leads if not smaller, steel, and blade just dents with each cut
customer_reviews.author: Juan Suarez

customer_reviews.title: These Wire Cutters are PERFECT for working on coil builds on my atomizers for ...
customer_reviews.text: These Wire Cutters are PERFECT for working on coil builds on my atomizers for my mechanical mods. They cut through 20g wire with no problem. They are a great buy in my personal opinion. I've had them for almost 2 years now and they still cut great although I will be buying another one soon (the same exact one) so I can get that buttery smooth cut again! I love the way they feel in my hands and how they cut with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Awesome clippers! Perfect for automotive wiring work.
customer_reviews.text: There are one of those tools you can't believe you've lived without. They're just a mini set of side cutters, but you realize pretty quickly that most jobs are covered with these much lighter clippers. Zip ties, heat shrink and lighter gauge wire are perfectly handled by these.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great cutters for keeping coils nice and flush on your post in your RDA
customer_reviews.text: Great cutters for keeping my coils flush with the post when I build my coils for my RDAs... I have been using them regularly at least once a day for over 3 months now and they are still sharp as I got them. Last pair I had (different brand) cost twice as much as these and did not hold well. I know I will keep getting these if I need news ones, and I highly recommend these to anyone who needs a flush cutting snip that holds up to heavy use. Just remember that this type of cutter is designed to be used with softer metals.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Machina

customer_reviews.title: Better than more expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of (expensive) microcutters at work so I had really high expectations coming into this purchase and these microcutters delivered. I use them mostly for zip ties, and these cut the ends completely flat to the zip tie. They honestly work better than some of the expensive ones at work. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Yeid

customer_reviews.title: They cut.
customer_reviews.text: What's to say about this cutter? They cut and can get into small hard to get to, areas. The last pair (a different brand) broke at the blades on the first day. These have lasted almost a month, so obviously made of better material. They are pretty invaluable for a hobbyist or someone, working around the PC
customer_reviews.author: jawnTEM

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I regret all the time I spent not having this cutter. They work much better than regular diagonal cutters and fit in much tighter areas. Only time will tell how long they last, but I imagine if you use them for their intended purpose (soft electrical wires), you shouldn't have any problem. They are well made and fit nicely in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: R Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great wire cutters.
customer_reviews.text: Great wire cutters. If you have wires that need cutting, cut them with these wire cutters. They are great for cutting wire. If you don't have any wire, but some so that you can use these wire cutters. They are that much fun to use. I am sure they can cut other smaller things too if you really wanted to. Maybe they could be used as very small scissors, but that wouldn't cut very straight unless you were a perfect cutter. The handles are very nice and easy to grip. I have been using them to cut wires and have been very happy with their wire cutting capability.
customer_reviews.author: Living Beyond Life, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and handy cheap disposable wire cutter
customer_reviews.text: The classic "Microsoft" wire cutter, at a fraction of the price. We have about 100 of these sitting in our factory and field trucks. They're a disposable tool. But you can get a lot of use out of it before it's ready to be replaced. I would imagine that the normal home user will get years of use from a single one.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Italians make fantastic steel -- they have for centuries. This $5 tool isn't as precise or refined as a German made Knipex, but at 1/8th the price, it gets the job done for most things. I use this for cutting zip ties, cat6 cables, and the like; never had an issue. Definitely have one for your toolbox just in case you need a wirecutter in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: James Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I needed these to clip some small plastic caps and tried 2 other cutters bought from my local hardware store before these. I could either find one with blades small enough to fit in the space I needed but not strong enough to cut through 1/16” of plastic , or blades strong enough but not nearly small enough to get into the space I needed. Luckily I found these micro cutters and they are both small enough to fit the space AND strong enough to actually make a nice, clean cut. The grip was the best of the 3 cutters I tried as well. 5 stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: lana e.

product_meta.title: Micro Cutter
product_meta.description: Size:Pack 1The Hakko CHP-170 cutter is an excellent general use tool.
feature_bullets: Flush-cut micro soft-wire cutter has 8mm long jaw with angled head for flush-cutting applications on up to 16 gauge (1.3mm) copper and soft wire
2.5mm heat-treated carbon steel construction provides durability and long life
Precision-ground holes and surfaces provide smooth movement, and spring returns tool to open position to reduce operator fatigue
Dolphin-style nonslip hand grips with curved fore-edge provide comfort and control, and Parkerized surfaces prevent glare and increase corrosion resistance

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
